author: Richard Newbern
text:
Brunswick, Georgia (pop. 16,000) is a coastal community with a struggling waterfront. We recently received a federal Dept. of Commerce grant to develop a masterplan for our primary waterfront park. It has docks, a gazabo overlooking the river, a vegetable market, and other facilities. Our masterplan will include upgrading park facilities and making the park more accessible to and from downtown Brunswick.
Question: My first Masterplan Stakeholders meeting will be held soon. Twenty merchants and park user group reps will be there. Many of them have endorsed the Masterplan project; however, many of the Stakeholders do not know one another very well.  HOW DO I APPROACH THIS FIRST STAKEHOLDERS MEETING? Should I discuss the project goal? Should I have "mini-pre-meetings" with major stakeholders prior to the first meeting? Should we discuss subcommittes at the very first meeting? I need to make this first meeting to be productive while also being collaborative. It will set the tone for the rest of the project.
Thank you.
Richard "Dick" Newbern
Brunswick, Georgia
title: First Stakeholders Meeting- Agenda and how to conduct it
